flawed_nl_solution:
If Beatrix has 30 books, Alannah has 30 books + 20 books = <<30+20=70>>70 books.
Queen has 1/5 * 70 books = <<1/5*70=14>>14 more books than Alannah.
The total number of books Queen has is 70 books + 14 books = <<70+14=84>>84 books.
All three have 84 books + 70 books + 30 books = <<84+70+30=184>>184 books together

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 50, not 70. It appears there was a miscalculation with the digits before the final zero.
